interlinear-text.item: Grunberg & Steblin-Kamensky. 1976/1988. La langue wakhi. Pt. 1 Corpus de litterature orale. Translated by Dominique Indjoudjian. Editions de la Maison des Sciences de L'homme Paris. p.47-48

phrase.item: Whether it is true or not, there once was a fly, an ant, and a jackdaw.
The ant boiled the milk, the fly made the fire.
Suddenly the ant fell into the milk.
Then the fly made his face black.
He went onto the doorstep where the jackdaw was sewing boots.
The jackdaw asked the fly.
Why did you make your face black?
He said that: "The ant fell into the milk."
Then the jackdaw poked a needle into his eyes.
He went to the courtyard where he met the goat.
The goat asked: "Why did you make your eyes blind?"
He said: "My good friend the ant fell into the milk."
The goat heard this and broke his horns.
Then he went next to the tree.
The tree asked the goat: "Why have you broken your horns?"
The goat said: "Our friend the ant fell into the milk,
The fly has made his face black,
The jackdaw made his eyes blind, I broke my horns.
The tree heard this then dropped his leaves.
Then the water came and asked:
"Hey tree, why do you not have leaves?"
The tree said: "Our friend the ant fell into the milk."
The fly made his face black, the jackdaw made his eyes blind,
the goat broke his horns, I dropped my leaves.
Then the water made himself narrow and went into the millet.
The millet asked the water, "Why did you make yourself narrow?"
The water said, "Our friend the ant fell into the milk,
The fly made his face black, the jackdaw made his eyes blind,
The goat broke his horns, the tree dropped his leaves,
I made myself narrow.
The millet hung his head.
The farmer came and asked,
"Hey millet, why did you hang your head?"
The millet said, "our friend the ant fell into the milk,
The fly made his face black, the jackdaw made his eyes blind,
The goat broke his horns, the tree dopped its leaves,
The water made himself narrow, I hung my head.
Then the farmer put his shovel into his jaw.
A girl was bringing him kefir.
She saw that there was a shovel in the farmer's jaw, and she asked:
"Why did you put a shovel into your jaw?"
The farmer said, "Our friend the ant has fallen into the milk,
The fly made his face black, the jackdaw made his eyes blind,
The goat broke his horns, the tree dropped its leaves,
The water made himself narrow, the millet hung his head,
I put a shovel into my jaw."
The girl poured the kefir on her head then went to the house.
Her mother asked her, "Why did you pour the kefir on your head?"
The girl said, "Our friend the ant has fallen into the milk,
The fly made his face black, the jackdaw made his eyes blind,
The goat broke his horns, the tree dropped its leaves,
The water made itself narrow, the millet hung his head,
The farmer put a shovel into his jaw,
I poured kefir on my head.
The old woman was surprised, she heated up that food,
sat on her butt, the old woman burned herself.
